thread.title: 2 people awake and alert after small plane crash near Austin, Texas, airport, emergency responders say - @statesman
thread.title_full: 2 people awake and alert after small plane crash near Austin, Texas, airport, emergency responders say - @statesman

author: Jimmy Lovaas
title: 2 people awake and alert after small plane crash near Austin, Texas, airport, emergency responders say - @statesman
text:
Fire officials: Small plane landed safely near Texas 130 toll booth 2:36 p.m. Tuesday, Aug. 4, 2015 | Filed in: Local Comments 0 ï»¿ 
2 p.m. update: The small plane had departed the Austin-Bergstrom International Airport shortly after 1 p.m. when it lost power to the engine, fire officials told reporters at a media briefing Tuesday. 
The pilot tried to return to the airport but struck a fence post during an emergency landing, officials said. 
Representatives with the Federal Aviation Administration and the National Transportation Safety Board are expected to arrive at the scene of the incident, officials said. Jay Janner Austin firefighters and medics responded Tuesday afternoon to reports of a plane crash south of Austin-Bergstrom International Airport. 
Austin Fire Department will remain at the scene until a fuel spill that started during the emergency landing is cleaned, a fire spokesman said. 
1:46 p.m. update: A small plane landed safely in a field just west of the Texas 130 toll booth near the Elroy Road exit, fire officials said. 
1:30 p.m. update: Two men in their 30s and 40s, who were aboard the small plane, have been evaluated by medics and are refusing treatment, according to Austin-Travis County Emergency Medical Services. Austin firefighters and medics responded Tuesday afternoon to reports of a plane crash south of Austin-Bergstrom International Airport. Photo: Jay Janner / AMERICAN-STATESMAN 
Air traffic to and from the airport has not been affected by the incident, an ABIA spokesman said. 
Eariler: Firefighters responding to reports of small plane crash south of the Austin-Bergstrom International Airport, officials said. 
About 1 p.m., authorities received reports of an aircraft emergency near Elroy Road and Texas 130 service road, just south of the Austin-Bergstrom International Airport, fire officials said. 
Two people, who were aboard the plane, are awake and alert, according to Austin-Travis County Emergency Medical Services. 
This story will be updated as more information becomes available.
